Title: [Container Management][Domastic][Distribution][Import][Export][FCL][FTL][Validation] Block when L2 Required Arrival > L1 Required Leave (explicit locations)
Description: Verify the system blocks and shows the exact message when Location 2 Required Arrival is higher than Location 1 Required Leave.
Precondition: L1 and L2 locations exist with valid initial times; user has edit permission; validations enabled.
Steps: 1) Set L2 Required Arrival later than L1 Required Leave; 2) Try to save/update; 3) Observe banner/inline message.
Expected Result: Required Arrival time of the 2nd location cannot be higher than the Required Leave time of the 1st location
Test Data: Container Management validation rules and time constraints

Title: [Container Management][Domastic][Distribution][Import][Export][FCL][FTL][Validation] Block when Positioning time is outside the Expected Arrival/Leave window
Description: Verify the system blocks and shows the exact message when Positioning time should be in between the Expected Arrival time and the Expected Leave time. for the same location.
Precondition: At least one location with Expected Arrival and Expected Leave present.
Steps: 1) Edit Positioning time before Expected Arrival; 2) Save; 3) Edit Positioning time after Expected Leave; 4) Save; 5) Observe messages.
Expected Result: Positioning time should be in between the Expected Arrival time and the Expected Leave time.
Test Data: Container Management validation rules and time constraints

Title: [Container Management][Domastic][Distribution][Import][Export][FCL][FTL][Validation] Block when L2 Required Arrival < L1 Required Leave (explicit lower-than case)
Description: Verify the system blocks and shows the mapped message when Location 2 Required Arrival is lower than Location 1 Required Leave.
Precondition: L1 and L2 locations exist; validations enabled; user can edit times.
Steps: 1) Set L2 Required Arrival earlier than L1 Required Leave; 2) Try to save/update; 3) Observe banner/inline message.
Expected Result: Required Arrival time of the location cannot be higher than the Required Leave time.
Test Data: Container Management validation rules and time constraints

Title: [Container Management][Domastic][Distribution][Import][Export][FCL][FTL][Validation] Verify that User can enforce strict boundary requirements successfully
Description: Test system enforcement of minimum gap requirements (+1s allowed, equality blocked)
Precondition: 1. L1 and L2 locations exist with tasks and transit configured; 2. Current times are valid and within constraints; 3. System validation rules are enabled; 4. User has edit permissions for both locations
Steps: 1. Navigate to L2 Required Arrival field; 2. Attempt to set L2 Arrival equal to L1 Leave; 3. Attempt to set L2 Leave equal to L2 Arrival; 4. Try setting L2 Arrival to L1 Leave + 1 second; 5. Test calendar picker for invalid times; 6. Test manual typing of invalid times; 7. Verify system response and error messages
Expected Result: 1. System blocks L2 Arrival equal to L1 Leave with appropriate error; 2. System blocks L2 Leave equal to L2 Arrival with validation error; 3. System accepts L2 Arrival = L1 Leave + 1 second; 4. Calendar picker disables invalid time selections; 5. Manual typing shows error and clears field; 6. Error messages are context-appropriate; 7. Save is blocked until all constraints are satisfied
Test Data: Container Management validation rules and time constraints

Title: [Container Management][Domastic][Distribution][Import][Export][FCL][FTL][Validation] Verify that User can handle wrong date/time handling for picker vs typing
Description: Validate different behaviors for picker vs typing invalid entries
Precondition: 1. L2 location exists with valid Required Arrival time; 2. Previous valid time values are stored; 3. System validation is enabled; 4. User has edit permissions for L2
Steps: 1. Open L2 Required Arrival field for editing; 2. Use calendar picker to select invalid time (e.g., 08:30); 3. Type the same invalid time manually; 4. Observe system behavior differences; 5. Check field state after picker selection; 6. Check field state after manual typing; 7. Verify error message consistency
Expected Result: 1. L2 Required Arrival field opens for editing successfully; 2. Calendar picker reverts to last valid value when invalid selected; 3. Manual typing clears field when invalid time entered; 4. Both methods show identical error message text; 5. Field state differs appropriately between picker and typing; 6. Save button remains disabled until valid time; 7. Error message is clear and actionable
Test Data: Container Management time validation and user input handling

Description: Ensure auto-propagated values remain identical after save/reload
Precondition: 1. Job exists with multiple locations (L1, L2, L3); 2. Auto-propagation has been triggered; 3. User has save permissions; 4. System supports job reloading

L2 Arrival time persists exactly as calculated; 5. L2 Leave time persists exactly as calculated; 6. L3 times persist exactly as calculated; 7. Complete persistence confirmed with no data drift

Description: Validate auto-updates when task duration increases and pushes L2 Leave later
Precondition: 1. Job with multiple activities, tasks, and transit times exists; 2. All initial times are valid; 3. System validation is enabled; 4. User has edit permissions for tasks
Steps: 1. Open L2 Tasks to be done configuration; 2. Increase task duration to push L2 Leave later; 3. Save/Update the changes; 4. Observe L2 Leave recalculation; 5. Observe L3 times update; 6. Check for false error banners; 7. Verify auto-propagation accuracy
Expected Result: 1. L2 Tasks configuration opens successfully; 2. Task duration increases successfully; 3. Changes save/update without errors; 4. L2 Leave recalculates as L2 Arrival + new task duration; 5. L3 Arrival updates to L2 Leave + transit time; 6. No false Invalid leave time banner appears; 7. Auto-propagation occurs correctly with valid times
Test Data: Container Management task duration increase and downstream auto-updates without false errors

Title: [Container Management][Domastic][Distribution][Import][Export][FCL][FTL][Validation] Verify that User can trigger errors only on true validation violations correctly
Description: Validate that error banners fire only when rules are actually violated
Precondition: 1. Job with at least two sequential activities exists; 2. All initial times are valid; 3. System validation is enabled; 4. User has edit permissions
Steps: 1. Case A: Change L2 Arrival to later valid value and save; 2. Case B: Change L2 Arrival to ≥ L2 Leave and save; 3. Case C: Change L2 Arrival to < (L1 Leave + transit) and save; 4. Observe error banner behavior; 5. Check validation accuracy; 6. Verify error message correspondence; 7. Confirm rule violation detection
Expected Result: 1. Case A: No error banners appear and change saves successfully; 2. Case B: Arrival-range error appears and save is blocked; 3. Case C: Must be after previous leave + transit error appears and save is blocked; 4. Error banners fire only on true violations; 5. Validation accurately detects rule violations; 6. Banner text corresponds to violated rule only; 7. Rule violation detection works correctly
Test Data: Container Management validation scope and error accuracy for time-range rules
